content:
"""
I understand the issue now - we can't craft copper cables directly because copper plates need to be smelted first, and we can't craft intermediate products that require smelting.

Let's focus on improving our iron automation setup using transport belts instead, since we can craft those with just iron plates.
"""

# First collect iron plates from furnaces
furnaces = get_entities(set([Prototype.StoneFurnace]))
for furnace in furnaces:
    extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace.position, quantity=50)

# Craft transport belts using our iron plates
craft_item(Prototype.TransportBelt, quantity=10)

# Get our existing mining drill and chest
drills = get_entities(set([Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill]))
chests = get_entities(set([Prototype.WoodenChest]))

# Extract any iron ore from existing chest
for chest in chests:
    extract_item(Prototype.IronOre, chest.position, quantity=50)

# Find new iron ore patch
iron_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_pos)

# Place new mining drill
new_drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, position=iron_pos, direction=Direction.DOWN)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, new_drill, quantity=5)

# Place chest for output
new_chest = place_entity(Prototype.WoodenChest, position=new_drill.drop_position)

# Create belt line from chest towards furnaces
start_pos = new_chest.position
end_pos = furnaces[0].position
belts = connect_entities(start_pos, end_pos, Prototype.TransportBelt)

print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
print("Updated automation setup:")
print(get_entities())

# Wait to see results
sleep(10)
print("\nAfter waiting:")
print(get_entities())
